rdf:Description.rdfs:label: William Trevor
William Trevor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ウィリアム・トレヴァー（William Trevor, 1928年5月24日 - ）はアイルランドのコーク州出身の作家。現在は、イギリスのデヴォン州在住。人物の造形にすぐれ、長篇、短篇ともに名手として高く評価されている。 イギリスとアイルランドの双方を舞台に、カトリックとプロテスタントに属する人々の対立や葛藤をしばしば描く。
rdf:Description.dbpedia-owl:abstract: William Trevor, KBE ist ein irischer Schriftsteller.

William Trevor, KBE (born 24 May 1928) is an Irish author and playwright. One of the elder statesmen of the Irish literary world, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest contemporary writers of short stories in the English language. Trevor has resided in England since the 1950s. Over the course of his long career he has written several novels and hundreds of short stories, for which he is best known. He has won the Whitbread Prize three times and has been nominated five times for the Booker Prize, most recently for his novel Love and Summer (2009), which was also shortlisted for the International IMPAC Dublin Literary Award in 2011. Tim Adams, a staff writer for The Observer, described him as "widely believed to be the most astute observer of the human condition currently writing in fiction".

William Trevor Cox é um tradutor, escritor de contos e novelista irlandês. Nascido numa família de classe-média protestante, viveu em várias cidades de província, devido às mudanças de posto de trabalho do seu pai, que trabalhava num banco oficial. Foi educado no St. Columba's College e no Trinity College, em Dublin. Neste último colégio graduou-se em História.
rdf:Description.dbpprop:name: Sir William Trevor
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Sir William Trevor
rdf:Description.dbpprop:name: Trevor, William
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sir William Trevor (de son vrai nom William Trevor Cox), né le 24 mai 1928 à Mitchelstown dans le comté de Cork en Irlande, est romancier, nouvelliste, dramaturge et scénariste. Lauréat de nombreux prix littéraires aussi bien en Irlande qu'en Grande-Bretagne ou aux États-Unis, membre de l'Académie irlandaise, anobli par la reine Élisabeth II d'Angleterre, Sir William Trevor a connu une consécration relativement tardive dans les pays francophones.
rdf:Description.dbpedia-owl:abstract: ウィリアム・トレヴァー（William Trevor, 1928年5月24日 - ）はアイルランドのコーク州出身の作家。現在は、イギリスのデヴォン州在住。人物の造形にすぐれ、長篇、短篇ともに名手として高く評価されている。 イギリスとアイルランドの双方を舞台に、カトリックとプロテスタントに属する人々の対立や葛藤をしばしば描く。
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: William Trevor, KBE (born 24 May 1928) is an Irish author and playwright. One of the elder statesmen of the Irish literary world, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest contemporary writers of short stories in the English language. Trevor has resided in England since the 1950s. Over the course of his long career he has written several novels and hundreds of short stories, for which he is best known.
William Trevor, KBE(honoraria) es un novelista y dramaturgo irlandés.
William Trevor, KBE ist ein irischer Schriftsteller.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: William Trevor
rdf:Description.dbpedia-owl:abstract: William Trevor, KBE, född 24 maj 1928 i Mitchelstown, County Cork, Irländska fristaten, är en irländsk författare, som skrivit pjäser, noveller och romaner. Han har skrivit Felicias resa som filmatiserades av Atom Egoyan. Trevor är gift sedan 1952.
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: William Trevor, KBE, född 24 maj 1928 i Mitchelstown, County Cork, Irländska fristaten, är en irländsk författare, som skrivit pjäser, noveller och romaner. Han har skrivit Felicias resa som filmatiserades av Atom Egoyan. Trevor är gift sedan 1952.

William Trevor Cox é um tradutor, escritor de contos e novelista irlandês. Nascido numa família de classe-média protestante, viveu em várias cidades de província, devido às mudanças de posto de trabalho do seu pai, que trabalhava num banco oficial. Foi educado no St. Columba's College e no Trinity College, em Dublin. Neste último colégio graduou-se em História.
rdf:Description.dbpedia-owl:abstract: William Trevor, KBE(honoraria) es un novelista y dramaturgo irlandés.

Sir William Trevor (de son vrai nom William Trevor Cox), né le 24 mai 1928 à Mitchelstown dans le comté de Cork en Irlande, est romancier, nouvelliste, dramaturge et scénariste. Lauréat de nombreux prix littéraires aussi bien en Irlande qu'en Grande-Bretagne ou aux États-Unis, membre de l'Académie irlandaise, anobli par la reine Élisabeth II d'Angleterre, Sir William Trevor a connu une consécration relativement tardive dans les pays francophones.
